results.content: The course is OK. Not as great as some Udemy courses on JavaScript or Python topics but at least this course is up-to-date (April 2021). I liked the section about database migrations and I did learn new things about Rails. I wouldn't recommend this course to a complete Ruby or Rails beginner though.

response.content: Hi Anna, I appreciate the review and the feedback. Noted on the content for complete beginners, I'm planning to refresh the course with additional content soon, so I will try to work on improvements to explain more on the basics, along with deploying the app to a production environment. Your feedback is helpful. Thanks :)

results.content: I would not recommend taking this course if you are on Windows. Furthermore, if you are a beginner then I don't think this is the right course for you. The instructor jumps into topics and expects you to already know everything there is to know. I took the course and still know nothing about Ruby on Rails.

response.content: Disappointing to see this. I know that you encountered issues when installing Rails on Windows and when I replied to you it was working already. Aside from that it is very intriguing that you didn't manage to learn anything from the course. You are the first out of hundreds of students to suggest this. Good luck to you and whatever you try to learn next.

results.content: As the title says, this is a course for those who are new to rails, a person who is a complete beginner. As such it does a very good job hitting most of the basics and at times even going beyond the basics, such as introducing Bootstrap and Devise. I think those new to rails can definitely benefit from this course. However, I cannot give it a full five stars due to it's lack of coverage of testing. Also, given that this is a course on Rails 6, I think it would benefit from better coverage of Webpacker.

response.content: Thanks for taking the time to leave a review and providing feedback regarding testing and webpacker. I'll try to include some additional videos for these on the next course update. Cheers
response.content_html: Thanks for taking the time to leave a review and providing feedback regarding testing and webpacker. I'll try to include some additional videos for these on the next course update. Cheers

results.content_html: As the title says, this is a course for those who are new to rails, a person who is a complete beginner. As such it does a very good job hitting most of the basics and at times even going beyond the basics, such as introducing Bootstrap and Devise. I think those new to rails can definitely benefit from this course. However, I cannot give it a full five stars due to it's lack of coverage of testing. Also, given that this is a course on Rails 6, I think it would benefit from better coverage of Webpacker.

results.content: Its fine, good if you are a total beginner. However there are sections such as the Active record section which you cant test working until you get into the next section as the presenter has added dummy data to their app but does not tell you how to do so until later. A similar thing happens earlier in the course too. Given this is aimed at beginners this isnt great as it adds some confusion

response.content: Hi Matthew, thank you for the review and feedback. I will go through and try to correct those issues you have experienced to make the course more streamlined. Thanks, David.

results.content: Due to covid-19, my IRL webdev bootcamp had to swap to online format. I decided to take up this course to supplement that learning and I have learnt more in the first few hour than i have in the last fortnight in my bootcamp. Excellent communicator, and does not elaborate unnecessarily.

results.content: I have not yet finished the course but so far it is great. It is one of the only Ruby on Rails up to date courses i have found. Most of the other courses on Ruby on Rails are outdated with older versions. The instructor explains things clearly and moves at a good pace. Plenty of time to go back and evaluate the sections and content.

Question: It seems as though it is more difficult to set up and run RonR apps on windows 10? true or false

response.content: Hi Michael, sorry to hear you are having set up issues on Windows platform. You can use Rails on Windows and I have linked out to resources in the set up videos but the best experience for Rails would be on Mac and Ubuntu. The course content should prove really helpful to you once you get set up and I'm hoping you can update the review to reflect the course content. Thanks
